definition: discrimination (against sb)/also written 歧視|歧视
surname Qi/also used in place names
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

sentences.english: The people are crying out against the racial discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 人们高叫反对种族岐视。

sentences.english: Gandhi tried hard to struggle against racial discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 甘地为反对种族岐视而进行了艰苦的斗争。

sentences.english: Gandhi won his first non-violent struggle against racial discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 甘地在种族岐视上赢得了他第一次非暴力战争。

sentences.english: Organizations that discriminate against race, gender, sexual orientation or religion.
sentences.chinese: 具有种族，性别，性取向及宗教岐视的组织机构。

sentences.english: The United States has adopted discriminatory export control policies towards China for many years.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，美国对中国采取岐视性出口管制政策。

sentences.english: Never tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 不允许任何岐视及骚扰。

definition: to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
